Award.AwardTitle: International Conference in Representations of Algebras (ICRA XVII)
Award.AbstractNarration:
This award will provide support for participants attending an international conference and workshop on Representations of Algebras (ICRA XVII) at Syracuse University from August 10-19, 2016. The ICRA is the preeminent international meeting in this area and this is the first time that it will be held in the United States. The meeting will consist of two parts: a 3.5 day workshop, and a 5 day conference. The workshop will feature six speakers each giving three one-hour talks. The conference will consist of eighteen 50-minute plenary lectures, together with parallel sessions of shorter presentations. The organizers expect around 150 participants. The award will be used to support travel and lodging for the workshop and plenary speakers as well as to support other participants, particularly junior researchers and graduate students. One of the primary goals of the conference is to promote interactions with other areas of mathematics by inviting prominent mathematicians in these areas to share their ideas and results.


Topics to be covered at the conference include: representations of quivers; Auslander-Reiten theory; tilting theory; homological properties of finite dimensional algebras; cluster algebras and categories; group representation theory; vector bundles on weighted projective spaces; preprojective algebras and applications of geometry to representation theory. Further information can be found at the conference website, http://icra2016.syr.edu/.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The international conference and workshop in representations of algebras (ICRA XVII) took place at Syracuse University from August 10-19, 2016. From August 10-13, 2016, there was a 3.5 day workshop, with 6 speakers who each gave 3 lectures: Claire Amiot (Universite Grenoble Alpes), Michel Brion (Institut Fourier), Markus Linckelmann (City University London), Robert Marsh (University of Leeds), Julia Pevtsova (University of Washington), and Ryo Takahashi (Nagoya University). From August 15-19, 2016, there was a 5 day conference, with 20 plenary lectures and 135 parallel lectures. The ICRA Award was shared by Greg Stevenson (University of Bielefeld) and Qiu Yu (Chinese University of Hong Kong). The conference webpage (http://icra2016.syr.edu) gives summaries of the talks, and videos of the workshop and plenary talks. A conference proceedings is expected to be published in 2018 by "Contemporary Mathematics" of the American Mathematical Society.


ICRA is the most important meeting in the area of representation theory of algebras and usually happens every other year in countries all over the world. The ICRA XVII in 2016 was the first ever ICRA meeting held in the United States of America. Representation theory of algebras is a very active and established area of research in algebra. The meeting highlighted recent advances in the representation theory of finite dimensional algebras and related areas. There were more than 220 participants from 30 countries attending the workshop and/or the conference. This was the second largest ICRA in history. A significant number of these participants were young researchers and women.  


The NSF funding was used to support travel and/or lodging for 71 participants. This included workshop speakers and plenary speakers in addition to some of the other participants, with an emphasis on mathematically young participants (recent doctorates and graduate students).
